Hi Matt,

the meeting was not very technical, the topics covered were Functional and
Load Testing.

In the case of Visual Components (COM, JAVA or HTML pages)  they are able
to automatically generate Test Scripts (Rational Quality Architect  is
doing the job for EJB and COM, Rational Robot is the one that capture the
Visual Aspects) based on the Use Case written in Rose (which becomes the
base to design Test Case) to validate the functional aspect. You can also
build your own scripts that can interact with VB or Java applications via
their Rational Test Script Services (their testing framework which is given
for free with Rose).

If you buy their Testing Suite, you have a Test Manager which gives a
central point to manage (run tests, reports errors, gather metrics and
build nice reports etc..) the distributed testing environment.

I think their offer is great coupled with Rose but Unit Testing as we
address it with jUnit does not seems to be covered.

Hope it helps,

Marc





"Matt Sinclair" <matthew.sinclair@...> on 12.03.2001 04:25:54

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

Subject:  [junit] Re: JUnit vs Rational Quality Architect


--- In junit@y..., msonnet@t... wrote:
> I'm going to see Rational this afternoon in Lausanne with exactly
> the same concern as you.

Did you have any luck with info on Rational QA?

M@
